p: There is currently no animal studies examining the immuno-stimulatory activity of mushrooms native to North America. However, there were many animal studies evaluating the immuno-stimulatory effects of mushrooms collected elsewhere [ 11]. For instance, there were animal studies examining immunomodulatory activity of G. lucidum and its related species, G. tsugae and G. applanatum [ 79]. In another study, Agarikon 1 and Agarikon Plus which contains medicinal mushroom mixtures, were found to activate and maintain the immune system equilibrium in an advanced colorectal mouse model [ 80]. Elsewhere, the hot water, methanol and polysaccharide extracts of Lentinula edodes induced immune response against eimeriasis in chicken [ 81].
